title: Liar - Set The World On Fire [1978] HQ Vinyl @ 128kbps
description:
Vinyl - LAME Rip @ 128kbps Joint Stereo

I saw this band supporting UFO in 1979 and was blown away. They were easily as good as the headliners. Steve Mann, the guitarist, ended up in McAuley Schenker Group and then Andy Scott&#039;s Sweet. Drummer, Clive Brooks was from Groundhogs. This is their second album. Apparently there was a third, but it never released! C&#039;mon ... somebody must have access to it somewhere.


Track Listing: Liar - Set The World On Fire 

Set The World on Fire 
Town of Evil People 
I&#039;m Calling 
Midnight Promises 
Five Knuckle Shuffle 
High Life 
Frustration 
Who Cares 


Musicians: Liar - Set The World On Fire 

Dave Burton 
Dave Taylor 
Steve Mann 
Clive Brooks 
Paul Travis

Produced by John Alcock for Delta Productions


Ripped from good quality vinyl for your listening pleasure. The vinyl was centralized which means there was absolutely no side to side movement of the tone arm. This is usually the major flaw with vinyl as it causes a "WOWING" effect noticable to most audiophiles. It is caused by the hole not being entirely central and is more annoying than the occasional click in my opinion. Also in use on the Dual 505 Record Deck was a Platter Pad [a solid rubber, turntable mat, about 1 and a half cm thick] which no user of vinyl should be without. It enhances the sound no end!
